interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: UPHUNAL Handmade Short Fake Nails, Artificial False Nails, Easy To Apply And Remove, Cool Full Cover Acrylic Nails Set, Professional Press On Nails High Quality Gel Nails With Design for Women and Girls 12Pcs (Cute Pink Flower) Review Date: 2022/01/29 Store: UPHUNAL Average Rating: 3.3 Product Details: {'Material': 'Acrylic', 'Brand': 'UPHUNAL', 'Style': 'Professional', 'Coverage': 'Full Well Tips', 'Number of Pieces': '12', 'Package Dimensions': '5.51 x 3.46 x 0.94 inches; 1.2 Ounces', 'UPC': '735626305894'} Review Text: I honestly don’t even know WHERE to begin with this review 🤷🏻‍♀️

I have, in my lifetime – and, wearing “fake” nails for OVER 25 YEARS – NEVER seen this type of … idea 🤦🏻‍♀️

I’ll be as short as possible with this …

Most anyone who hasn’t had an amputation, usually has 8 fingers and 2 thumbs – total of 10 “DIGITS” ✋🏻🤚🏻 And, in MOST cases – the nails are usually shaped the same.

Thus, in a set of nails you’d need:

💅🏻 2 – Thumb nails
💅🏻 2 – Index fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Middle fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Ring fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Pinkie fingernails

I know – sounds almost silly or stupid to mention, but that’s math. Total “NAILS” needed: 10 … (“Luxury 12pcs press on nails kit comes with 10 different sizes which is pre-numbered 0-9 in a box” … “choose the most suitable size that fits you every finger”). Hard to fit every finger when the nails are different sizes.

And, we’re NOT all sized the same. Hence why some packaging is no less than 24 nails with 12 sizes. I know because I’ve bought nails like this for YEARS! Just look up KISS and you’ll see what I am talking about.

This?

Was this a joke? This is a set of TWELVE (12) nails – 10 different sizes! 🤷🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️

Unlike the model hands – I don’t wear my nails OVER the edges of my finger. That is NOT how you wear these nails to begin with – and definitely NOT with nail glue. Even being “fake”, the nails should at LEAST attempt to look realistic. See how the salons do them, look on Google (or your favorite search engine).

Who thought this was a great idea? And, these HAVE to be the LARGEST sizes for the particular “nails” I’ve seen. These really are a fancier version of the Lee and Wet N’ Wild from the late 1980’s/early 1990’.

What’s worse? Even the PACKAGING states: 24

Did they not think anyone would notice that detail?

I’ll admit, these are pretty. And, thinking it was a HALF package, I contacted Amazon for a return/replacement. I cancelled the replacement, but I am returning these. As I told the rep – they’re pretty useless as they are. There is NO way I can use these. I would, at MINIMUM, only get 4 nails worth of coverage. For this price? Nope. Not at all. And, I feel sorry for those who do have to pay.

In addition, the nearly $16 price tag (excluding sales tax) for 12 nails? Unreasonable. In my case, I’d need TWO (2) sets which would run $32. For that price – I might as well just wear a mask, go to the salon, and have them do it for me. My nails would definitely last two weeks, and I wouldn’t have to do them myself.

I will not be getting these again and DO NOT recommend them. The seller might have a better set out there, but not this selection. Review Title: Not Sure if This is a Joke Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Biutee Starry Sky Nail Gel Firework Nail Gel With black Nail Polish Gel 8ml UV LED Biutee {'Brand': 'Biutee', 'Item Form': 'Gel', 'Type': 'Gel', 'Material Feature': 'Non-Toxic, Cruelty Free', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Unit Count': '3.5274 Ounce', 'Number of Items': '2', 'Liquid Volume': '0.27 Fluid Ounces', 'Package Dimensions': '4.92 x 3.31 x 1.77 inches; 4.59 Ounces'} Thank you in advance to the Amazon VINE program for providing an item to review. A positive review was not required, nor was it requested, and all words are my own.

Getting my nails done is not just a relaxing experience, but it is also an expressive/creative one.

Seeing this colorful and glittery set – I had to get it.

I don’t know about others’ experiences – mine did not come with a brush or applicator for the little “gel pots”. I remembered what my nail techs used to use – small make-up brushes – and thankfully I had some. That seemed to work.

The black polish is necessary to get the desired effect. I chose the purple glitter gel and after a few awkward moments – I got a pretty decent manicure. More of the black showed through, there were moments when the purple glitter reflected, but it wasn’t what I thought.

I haven’t tried the other colors. But, this is fairly decent and easy to use. Not my favorite as there are other brands out there that are even easier to use.

Overall, I’m not too unhappy with it. It’s not something I would likely purchase again. Not so Starry STYLEAGAL Portable Electric Nail Drill, Manicure Pedicure Drill Kit Professional nail starter kit for beginners acrylic with drill（2020 Upgraded） styleagal {'Brand': 'styleagal', 'Voltage': '5 Volts', 'Power Source': 'Battery Powered', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.8 x 4.5 x 2 inches; 8.01 Ounces', 'UPC': '782913461771', 'Manufacturer': 'STYLEAGAL'} Pretty standard nail drill.

This is similar, if not identical to most of the nail drills used in the salon.

Best used to remove gel polishes and/or nail tips to prepare them for other polishes or plain removal. Standard Nail Drill 20pcs Nail Tips Clips for Quick Building Polygel Nail Forms Nail Tips Clip for Finger Nail Extension DIY Manicure Nail Art Tool tiggell {'Size': '20 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Material': 'Plastic', 'Brand': 'Tiggell', 'Style': 'French', 'Coverage': 'Full Well Tips', 'Package Dimensions': '8.98 x 6.85 x 2.2 inches; 4.16 Ounces', 'UPC': '795853588163'} I mainly got these for a “home-made” gel soak off (using foil).

And, they worked! They don’t pinch at all; even my mom used them and said she could barely feel them.

Light weight and fairly durable. There are enough for two people to use at the same time, or extras on hand if they ever break.

If used for poly gels, I’m sure they would work just as well. Nail Clips Acrylic Nail Powder Set Vcedas 24 Colors Acrylic Nail Art Tips UV Gel Carving Powder Dust Design Decoration 3D Manicure Vcedas {'Product Dimensions': '5.91 x 3.94 x 0.79 inches; 1.3 Pounds'} Be warned, this is NOT “dip powder”. This is indeed acrylic powder in VERY small jars.

This does not come with instructions though – at least mine didn’t. So that could make this a bit hard to work with.

The colors are pretty though.

This isn’t the best kit out there, I have seen better ones. The packaging isn’t that stable or durable. I ended up putting the jars in a pencil case.

I honestly wouldn’t get it again. As far as durability, I usually do my manicure every week or so. Not The Best Set Out There UV LED Nail Lamp – 128W Rapid-Curing Gel Nails Dryer for Manicures and Pedicures – Dual-Voltage with Extra-Long Cable, Multi-Language Manual – Professional Gel Lamp for Homes or Salons by OVLUX, Gold OVLUX {'Brand': 'OVLUX', 'Special Feature': 'Energy Efficient', 'Light Source Type': 'LED', 'Material': 'Gel', 'Connectivity Technology': 'USB', 'Package Dimensions': '9.4 x 8.3 x 4.3 inches; 1.55 Pounds', 'UPC': '765453999881'} This UV/LED lamp is by far one of the best I’ve used. I have another one by OVLUX (one of my favorites). So, when I saw this, I didn’t hesitate to get it to have on standby.

There are a few issues with it, but I’m overall pleased.

Very easy to use. Gold Standard of Lamps Cherry Blossom Hand & Body Sugar Polish by South of France Clean Body Care | Moisturizing Sugar Scrub for Women | Shea Butter + Sunflower Oil | 8 oz Tube South of France Natural Body Care {'Brand': 'South of France Natural Body Care', 'Product Benefits': 'Moisturizing', 'Active Ingredients': 'Shea butter', 'Material Feature': 'Gluten Free, Natural', 'Item Volume': '8 Fluid Ounces', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 2.8 x 2 inches; 8.8 Ounces', 'UPC': '856885005148', 'Manufacturer': 'South Of France LLC'} I really wanted to LOVE this scrub – there was just too much wrong with it to even LIKE it.

First of all – this is FAR TOO THICK to squeeze out of the tube. I had to SMASH it with my arm to get it to MOVE.

The scent? If you’re looking for Bath & Body Works type of Cherry Blossom, you’re not going to get it.

Once you get it out, and can take the scent – after it is applied, it is a soft, moisturizing and no slip scrub.

This isn’t something I’d get again or recommend. Not The Worst, But Definitely Not The Best 3 Barrel Curling Iron, 25mm Curling Waver Iron Hair Waver with LCD Display Adjustable Temperature 1 Inch Tourmaline Ceramic Triple Hair Crimper Hair Tools for Deep Waves All Style (1#) Solati {'Brand': 'Solati', 'Hair Type': 'Wavy, Curly, Normal', 'Material': 'Ceramic', 'Power Source': 'Corded Electric', 'Max Temperature Setting': '210 Degrees Celsius', 'Package Dimensions': '15.94 x 4.21 x 3.5 inches; 1.54 Pounds', 'UPC': '757350981861', 'Manufacturer': 'Solati'} I have been trying, for well over 30 years, to get a curling iron that actually did what it was supposed to – curl my hair.

Hot curlers – no good results

Curling Irons (¼, ½) – no good results

Wrap-Around Fabric Curlers – nothing there

I saw this and thought it couldn’t fail. Simple to use – plug in, turn on, heat up, section hair, and use – put hair in, count down.

Works in theory, fails in execution. First up – there is NO heat seating guide for SAFE curling. THIS DEVICE IS CELSIUS (C) ONLY, NO FARENHEIT (F) OPTION. Google is strongly needed here.

According to Redken: “For those with fine or thin hair, keep your iron set below 200 (so below 100°C on this device) degrees Fahrenheit. Any higher and your strands may burn. For those with coarse or thicker hair, have your curling iron set between 200 degrees and 300 degrees (148.9°C or on this device 150) Fahrenheit for optimal curls” [9 Curling Iron Secrets You Need to Know About/Redken]

Using that, as well as Glamour’s 8-10 second rule [How to Curl Your Hair Correctly: 7 Mistakes to Avoid – Glamour; “Drill it into your brain: You should hold an iron on your hair for eight to 10 seconds max”], along with using thinner groups of hair – I should have SOME wave. Nope. I even went 25 seconds. Nothing.

As my hair has become a bit thinner, has been color treated, and exposed to SO much – I wasn’t about to turn this up hotter.

The curler is designed much like a crimper, but the “width” can make it difficult to handle, especially by yourself. There is a “guard” which heats up as well and it is easy to burn yourself.

It wins with innovative idea as well as the digital temp gauge. Also, it does heat up SUPER fast, as well as cool down just as fast when lowering the temp.

For use by myself – this is a two star deal. Perhaps if someone else were around it might be easier, but this definitely did not work well. Barely Made a Wave Toenail Clippers Set, MOMSIV 10 pcs Professional Stainless Steel Pedicure Clippers Toenail Cutters, Super Sharp Men's Nail Clippers Toenail Clippers Set for Thickness & Ingrown Hard Toenails MOMSIV {'Color': 'Upgrade Black', 'Brand': 'MOMSIV', 'Material': 'Stainless Steel', 'Blade Edge': 'Curved', 'Blade Material': 'Stainless Steel', 'Package Dimensions': '7.68 x 4.41 x 1.38 inches; 9.59 Ounces', 'Manufacturer': 'MOMSIV'} Colorful manicure and pedicure kit for home, gym, or travel.

Has most everything needed and easy to store. Love the pretty case. Price is great as well.

Each tool is functional and works great. Perfect Manicure Set Spanature Aloe Vera Hand & Body Lotion Travel Size Selection, 4 Pack, Relaxing and Revitalizing Moisturizer for Rough and Dry Skin, Nourishing and Gentle for All Skin Types, Made In Korea - 75 ml/2.53oz Spanature {'Brand': 'Spanature', 'Item Form': 'Lotion', 'Unit Count': '10.1 Ounce', 'Number of Items': '4', 'Use for': 'Hands', 'Package Dimensions': '4.21 x 3.62 x 2.8 inches; 1.05 Pounds', 'UPC': '088234470585'} This product as a lot going for it. I love the idea of the individually gift boxed tubes, the cap is wonderful (huge and easy to use), the product is generously sized.

The problem is that this stuff is runny, doesn’t absorb that well on me, and the “scent” that is there – it isn’t that great.

For $15 before tax, that is roughly $3.75 a tube, and while they’re smaller – I’d honestly stick with Bath & Body Works.

This isn’t something I’d get again and I wouldn’t recommend it. I also wouldn’t give it as a gift. It Slightly Works Tirtyl Hand Soap Sheet Variety Pack - 240 Pack with Portable Storage Tin - Camping/Outdoor/Travel/Handbag - Lavender & Aloe - Bergamot & Ylang Ylang - Jasmine & Patchouli Tirtyl {'Brand': 'Tirtyl', 'Scent': 'Bergamot,Lavender,Jasmine', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Unit Count': '240.00 Count', 'Package Dimensions': '9.88 x 6.26 x 0.75 inches; 3.21 Ounces'} As most have said here – these are great for travel, especially when you can’t find soap around but have water. Though I wouldn’t carry a bar of soap, I have used “travel” size body wash as a hand soap. If it cleans the body, should clean the hands, right?

Anyway …

The metal container I got was dented, but that is okay as I don’t intend to travel where I won’t have soap. So, I’m using these at my bathroom sink.

LET ME STATE THIS AS A WARNING: HANDS MUST BE DRY BEFORE GRABBING A SOAP SHEET.

I know all caps is yelling, but trust me – it is for a VERY GOOD reason. As one reviewer said, even a drop of water can damage these.

Basically I grab a one with dry hands, hold it in palm, turn water on, let it dissolve. Good lather, I don’t really smell a “scent”, hands wash clean. They don’t dry out, but I do use a moisturizing sanitizer, and hand lotion after.

I wouldn’t say these go years – if you’re like me and using them as an alternative to other hand soaps to preserve waste, they might last about a month (8 washes per day, 30 days). If only as travel backup – they might last a few years. Again, it depends on how they’re used.

I personally find them a bit on the pricey side at almost $10 before tax. That’s just me.

I do have other soaps, and these should last me a while. I would not recommend them as a body wash. As opposed to carrying a bar of soap, try a travel container with body wash. Just my suggestion. Great for Travel YOUNG VISION Pearl Hard Wax Beads for Hair Removal, Wax Beans 1000 g/2.2 lb/35 oz for Home Waxing, Painless Bikini&Brazilian Waxing Beads, Thick/Coarse Hair Removal Wax Kit, Sensitive Skin Friendly YOUNG VISION {'Item Form': 'Wax', 'Skin Type': 'All', 'Brand': 'YOUNG VISION', 'Unit Count': '1 Count', 'Package Dimensions': '7.99 x 6.14 x 4.88 inches; 2.72 Pounds'} I think a lot of us want an easier way to remove hair. Shaving, especially for a bigger girl like me, is not that easy. It’s worse when you have long legs, short arms.

It’s bad when you have certain chin hairs (thankfully not that much it isn’t manageable another way).

I tried some sugar wax kit back about 20+ years ago. That was a NIGHTMARE! It was supposedly edible. I think you microwaved the container, spread it on, let it cool, used a paper strip (supplied) to remove the hair. It didn’t work and stung.

I then moved to a hair removal cream, that partially worked.

After that? Back to the hold stand-by –> shave foam/cream and a razor. For my main body parts, that’s always worked. Tough “chin” hairs –> using a tweezer work. No, the dermaplaning tool didn’t work on them.

I got a wax warmer, so I thought all beads/beans were equal.

These came with ZERO instructions, and the after spray bottle was busted. The warmer kit at least had some. And, my warmer kit had specially made, disposable “cups”.

These beads/beans, in a smaller cup, took over 90 minute to melt. And, the warmer was on 180°(F).

I tried a small amount on my arm. The wax was sticky, not liquidy, and it cooled almost as soon as it hit my skin.

I let it sit there for a few minutes (over 5), and peeled the max off. It didn’t hurt, sting, or cause redness – then again …

THE HAIR WAS STILL THERE

Okay, so my hair on my arm is a little thin. But, if this removes thick hair, shouldn’t it remove thinner hair?

I found another patch, got some warm wax – tried it again. Nope. Tried legs, arms, and under my chin. Nothing. Then again, I see I'm not the only one experiencing issues with these beads/beans.

I may have gotten a bad batch. But, I definitely wouldn’t get these again. Wax On, Wax Off, Hair Still There FIDDY898 Gold Silver Floral Hair Comb For Bride Tiny Beaded Wedding Hair Jewelry-Silver FIDDY898 {'Brand': 'FIDDY898', 'Hair Type': 'All', 'Color': 'Gold,Silver', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Package Dimensions': '5.9 x 3.9 x 2.2 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FDSD061101'} This is, for less than $10, a lovely comb.

Can function at a wedding or other event. However, the cons outweigh the beauty.

Given how delicate this is, there is NO storage box or bag. So, after use – where does one put it? That is an issue for me. Even a simple velvet type bag would be a good idea.

Second? The comb itself.

While absolutely stunning in design – function is a bit questionable because of the construction. The combs are “OPEN” design – thus loose hairs can weave in, particularly those with thick and curly hair. This makes removal or readjusting a bit difficult if not a tad uncomfortable.

This is also for thicker hair, not thin, and thus circles back to the issue I just presented.

While pretty, it isn’t something I am particularly pleased with. It isn’t something I would get for myself again. I also wouldn’t give it as a gift. Beautiful But Need to Be Cautious When Using NULASTIN Skin – Gentle Exfoliating Cleanser | Invigorating Face Scrub with Caffeine, Jojoba Oil Beads, Calendula Flower Extract & Witch Hazel — For Dry, Oily & Sensitive Skin (Vegan & Cruelty-Free) NULASTIN {'Brand': 'NULASTIN', 'Item Form': 'Oil', 'Skin Type': 'Dry,All Skin Types', 'Product Benefits': 'Exfoliating', 'Material Feature': 'Cruelty Free, Vegan', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '1.38 x 2.36 x 6.5 inches; 6.88 Ounces', 'UPC': '718122770717'} This is an exfoliating facial cleanser that really didn't feel that great or give me that much in benefits. For $23 it is not something I'd get again or recommend. It was slightly overpriced and overhyped. Underwhelming Cleanser UPHUNAL Handmade Short Fake Nails, Artificial False Nails, Easy To Apply And Remove, Cool Full Cover Acrylic Nails Set, Professional Press On Nails High Quality Gel Nails With Design for Women and Girls 12Pcs (Cute Pink Flower) UPHUNAL {'Material': 'Acrylic', 'Brand': 'UPHUNAL', 'Style': 'Professional', 'Coverage': 'Full Well Tips', 'Number of Pieces': '12', 'Package Dimensions': '5.51 x 3.46 x 0.94 inches; 1.2 Ounces', 'UPC': '735626305894'} I honestly don’t even know WHERE to begin with this review 🤷🏻‍♀️

I have, in my lifetime – and, wearing “fake” nails for OVER 25 YEARS – NEVER seen this type of … idea 🤦🏻‍♀️

I’ll be as short as possible with this …

Most anyone who hasn’t had an amputation, usually has 8 fingers and 2 thumbs – total of 10 “DIGITS” ✋🏻🤚🏻 And, in MOST cases – the nails are usually shaped the same.

Thus, in a set of nails you’d need:

💅🏻 2 – Thumb nails
💅🏻 2 – Index fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Middle fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Ring fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Pinkie fingernails

I know – sounds almost silly or stupid to mention, but that’s math. Total “NAILS” needed: 10 … (“Luxury 12pcs press on nails kit comes with 10 different sizes which is pre-numbered 0-9 in a box” … “choose the most suitable size that fits you every finger”). Hard to fit every finger when the nails are different sizes.

And, we’re NOT all sized the same. Hence why some packaging is no less than 24 nails with 12 sizes. I know because I’ve bought nails like this for YEARS! Just look up KISS and you’ll see what I am talking about.

This?

Was this a joke? This is a set of TWELVE (12) nails – 10 different sizes! 🤷🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️

Unlike the model hands – I don’t wear my nails OVER the edges of my finger. That is NOT how you wear these nails to begin with – and definitely NOT with nail glue. Even being “fake”, the nails should at LEAST attempt to look realistic. See how the salons do them, look on Google (or your favorite search engine).

Who thought this was a great idea? And, these HAVE to be the LARGEST sizes for the particular “nails” I’ve seen. These really are a fancier version of the Lee and Wet N’ Wild from the late 1980’s/early 1990’.

What’s worse? Even the PACKAGING states: 24

Did they not think anyone would notice that detail?

I’ll admit, these are pretty. And, thinking it was a HALF package, I contacted Amazon for a return/replacement. I cancelled the replacement, but I am returning these. As I told the rep – they’re pretty useless as they are. There is NO way I can use these. I would, at MINIMUM, only get 4 nails worth of coverage. For this price? Nope. Not at all. And, I feel sorry for those who do have to pay.

In addition, the nearly $16 price tag (excluding sales tax) for 12 nails? Unreasonable. In my case, I’d need TWO (2) sets which would run $32. For that price – I might as well just wear a mask, go to the salon, and have them do it for me. My nails would definitely last two weeks, and I wouldn’t have to do them myself.

I will not be getting these again and DO NOT recommend them. The seller might have a better set out there, but not this selection. Not Sure if This is a Joke
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Product Interest**: The user remains dedicated to nail care and skincare, with an increasing focus on hair accessories. Their recent purchase reflects a high standard for product quality, emphasizing disappointment when items do not meet expectations.

- **Aesthetic Preference**: They continue to appreciate visually striking designs in grooming products, valuing both beauty and practicality that align with their vibrant personal style.

- **User Experience Emphasis**: Usability is crucial; the user expressed significant dissatisfaction with a recent nail product due to poor design and insufficient sizes. Their need for thoughtful design underscores the importance of functionality alongside aesthetics.

- **Critical Evaluation**: The user exhibits a keen and critical eye in detailed product reviews, highlighting flaws in quality and effectiveness. They expect products to deliver as promised and are quick to express discontent when they don’t.

- **Learning Curve**: Open to new grooming tools, they consistently seek comprehensive instructions and effective designs to improve their experiences.

- **Comparative Mindset**: The user thoroughly compares new products with established favorites, maintaining rigorous standards for quality and functionality.

- **Overall Satisfaction**: They advocate for improved product design and user support, emphasizing the need for a balance between creativity and practicality in their grooming journey. Recent experiences further reinforce their commitment to discerning product evaluation and selection.
